info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 2:22PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Macon, Swain and Graham Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 221 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of Maryville Tennessee to 14 miles north of Robbinsville to 16 miles east of Madisonville Tennessee. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Bryson City, Robbinsville, Santeetlah, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Fontana Lake, Nantahala Lake, Fontana Village and Smoky Mountains-Deep Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
